49QMenu *QMenuPrivate::mouseDown = nullptr;
50
51/* QMenu code */
52// internal class used for the torn off popup
53class QTornOffMenu : public QMenu
54{
55 Q_OBJECT
56 class QTornOffMenuPrivate : public QMenuPrivate
57 {
58 Q_DECLARE_PUBLIC(QTornOffMenu)
59 public:
60 QTornOffMenuPrivate(QMenu *p) : causedMenu(p), initialized(false) {
61 tornoff = 1;
62 causedPopup.widget = nullptr;
63 causedPopup.action = p->d_func()->causedPopup.action;
64 causedStack = p->d_func()->calcCausedStack();
65 }
66
67 void setMenuSize(const QSize &menuSize) {
68 Q_Q(QTornOffMenu);
69 QSize size = menuSize;
70 const QPoint p = (!initialized) ? causedMenu->pos() : q->pos();
71 const QRect screen = popupGeometry(screen: QGuiApplication::screenAt(point: p));
72 const int desktopFrame = q->style()->pixelMetric(metric: QStyle::PM_MenuDesktopFrameWidth, option: nullptr, widget: q);
73 const int titleBarHeight = q->style()->pixelMetric(metric: QStyle::PM_TitleBarHeight, option: nullptr, widget: q);
74 if (scroll && (size.height() > screen.height() - titleBarHeight || size.width() > screen.width())) {
75 const int fw = q->style()->pixelMetric(metric: QStyle::PM_MenuPanelWidth, option: nullptr, widget: q);
76 const int hmargin = q->style()->pixelMetric(metric: QStyle::PM_MenuHMargin, option: nullptr, widget: q);
77 scroll->scrollFlags |= uint(QMenuPrivate::QMenuScroller::ScrollDown);
78 size.setWidth(qMin(a: actionRects.at(i: getLastVisibleAction()).right() + fw + hmargin + rightmargin + 1, b: screen.width()));
79 size.setHeight(screen.height() - desktopFrame * 2 - titleBarHeight);
80 }
81 q->setFixedSize(size);
82 }
83
84 QList<QPointer<QWidget>> calcCausedStack() const override { return causedStack; }
85 QPointer<QMenu> causedMenu;
86 QList<QPointer<QWidget>> causedStack;
87 bool initialized;
88 };
89
90public:
91 QTornOffMenu(QMenu *p) : QMenu(*(new QTornOffMenuPrivate(p)))
92 {
93 Q_D(QTornOffMenu);
94 // make the torn-off menu a sibling of p (instead of a child)
95 QWidget *parentWidget = d->causedStack.isEmpty() ? p : d->causedStack.constLast();
96 if (parentWidget->parentWidget())
97 parentWidget = parentWidget->parentWidget();
98 setParent(parent: parentWidget, f: Qt::Window | Qt::Tool);
99 setAttribute(Qt::WA_DeleteOnClose, on: true);
100 setAttribute(Qt::WA_X11NetWmWindowTypeMenu, on: true);
101 updateWindowTitle();
102 setEnabled(p->isEnabled());
103#if QT_CONFIG(style_stylesheet)
104 setStyleSheet(p->styleSheet());
105#endif
106 if (style() != p->style())
107 setStyle(p->style());
108 setContentsMargins(p->contentsMargins());
109 setLayoutDirection(p->layoutDirection());
110 //QObject::connect(this, SIGNAL(triggered(QAction*)), this, SLOT(onTrigger(QAction*)));
111 //QObject::connect(this, SIGNAL(hovered(QAction*)), this, SLOT(onHovered(QAction*)));
112 QList<QAction*> items = p->actions();
113 for(int i = 0; i < items.size(); i++)
114 addAction(action: items.at(i));
115 d->setMenuSize(sizeHint());
116 d->initialized = true;
117 }
118 void syncWithMenu(QMenu *menu, QActionEvent *act)
119 {
120 Q_D(QTornOffMenu);
121 if (menu != d->causedMenu)
122 return;
123 auto action = static_cast<QAction *>(act->action());
124 if (act->type() == QEvent::ActionAdded) {
125 insertAction(before: static_cast<QAction *>(act->before()), action);
126 } else if (act->type() == QEvent::ActionRemoved)
127 removeAction(action);
128 }
129 void actionEvent(QActionEvent *e) override
130 {
131 Q_D(QTornOffMenu);
132 QMenu::actionEvent(e);
133 if (d->initialized) {
134 d->setMenuSize(sizeHint());
135 }
136 }
137
138 void updateWindowTitle()
139 {
140 Q_D(QTornOffMenu);
141 if (!d->causedMenu)
142 return;
143 const QString &cleanTitle = QPlatformTheme::removeMnemonics(original: d->causedMenu->title()).trimmed();
144 setWindowTitle(cleanTitle);
145 }
146
147public slots:
148 void onTrigger(QAction *action) { d_func()->activateAction(action, QAction::Trigger, self: false); }
149 void onHovered(QAction *action) { d_func()->activateAction(action, QAction::Hover, self: false); }
150
151private:
152 Q_DECLARE_PRIVATE(QTornOffMenu)
153 friend class QMenuPrivate;
154};
155
156void QMenuPrivate::init()
157{
158 Q_Q(QMenu);
159#if QT_CONFIG(whatsthis)
160 q->setAttribute(Qt::WA_CustomWhatsThis);
161#endif
162 q->setAttribute(Qt::WA_X11NetWmWindowTypePopupMenu);
163 defaultMenuAction = menuAction = new QAction(q);
164 menuAction->setMenu(q); // this calls setOverrideMenuAction
165 setOverrideMenuAction(nullptr);
166 QObject::connect(sender: menuAction, signal: &QAction::changed, slot: [this] {
167 if (!tornPopup.isNull())
168 tornPopup->updateWindowTitle();
169 });
170 q->setMouseTracking(q->style()->styleHint(stylehint: QStyle::SH_Menu_MouseTracking, opt: nullptr, widget: q));
171 if (q->style()->styleHint(stylehint: QStyle::SH_Menu_Scrollable, opt: nullptr, widget: q)) {
172 scroll = new QMenuPrivate::QMenuScroller;
173 scroll->scrollFlags = QMenuPrivate::QMenuScroller::ScrollNone;
174 }
175
176 sloppyState.initialize(menu: q);
177 delayState.initialize(parent: q);
178 mousePopupDelay = q->style()->styleHint(stylehint: QStyle::SH_Menu_SubMenuPopupDelay, opt: nullptr, widget: q);
179}
180
181QPlatformMenu *QMenuPrivate::createPlatformMenu()
182{
183 Q_Q(QMenu);
184 if (platformMenu.isNull())
185 q->setPlatformMenu(QGuiApplicationPrivate::platformTheme()->createPlatformMenu());
186 return platformMenu.data();
187}
188
189void QMenuPrivate::setPlatformMenu(QPlatformMenu *menu)
190{
191 Q_Q(QMenu);
192 if (!platformMenu.isNull() && !platformMenu->parent())
193 delete platformMenu.data();
194
195 platformMenu = menu;
196 if (!platformMenu.isNull()) {
197 QObject::connect(sender: platformMenu, SIGNAL(aboutToShow()), receiver: q, SLOT(_q_platformMenuAboutToShow()));
198 QObject::connect(sender: platformMenu, SIGNAL(aboutToHide()), receiver: q, SIGNAL(aboutToHide()));
199 }
200}
201
202void QMenuPrivate::syncPlatformMenu()
203{
204 Q_Q(QMenu);
205 if (platformMenu.isNull())
206 return;
207
208 QPlatformMenuItem *beforeItem = nullptr;
209 const QList<QAction*> actions = q->actions();
210 for (QList<QAction*>::const_reverse_iterator it = actions.rbegin(), end = actions.rend(); it != end; ++it) {
211 QPlatformMenuItem *menuItem = insertActionInPlatformMenu(action: *it, beforeItem);
212 beforeItem = menuItem;
213 }
214 platformMenu->syncSeparatorsCollapsible(enable: collapsibleSeparators);
215 platformMenu->setEnabled(q->isEnabled());
216}
217
218static QWidget *getParentWidget(const QAction *action)
219{
220 auto result = action->parent();
221 while (result && !qobject_cast<QWidget *>(o: result))
222 result = result->parent();
223 return static_cast<QWidget *>(result);
224}
225
226void QMenuPrivate::copyActionToPlatformItem(const QAction *action, QPlatformMenuItem *item)
227{
228 item->setText(action->text());
229 item->setIsSeparator(action->isSeparator());
230 if (action->isIconVisibleInMenu()) {
231 item->setIcon(action->icon());
232 if (QWidget *w = getParentWidget(action)) {
233 QStyleOption opt;
234 opt.initFrom(w);
235 item->setIconSize(w->style()->pixelMetric(metric: QStyle::PM_SmallIconSize, option: &opt, widget: w));
236 } else {
237 QStyleOption opt;
238 item->setIconSize(QApplication::style()->pixelMetric(metric: QStyle::PM_SmallIconSize, option: &opt, widget: nullptr));
239 }
240 } else {
241 item->setIcon(QIcon());
242 }
243 item->setVisible(action->isVisible());
244#if QT_CONFIG(shortcut)
245 item->setShortcut(action->shortcut());
246#endif
247 item->setCheckable(action->isCheckable());
248 item->setChecked(action->isChecked());
249 item->setHasExclusiveGroup(action->actionGroup() && action->actionGroup()->isExclusive());
250 item->setFont(action->font());
251 item->setRole((QPlatformMenuItem::MenuRole) action->menuRole());
252 item->setEnabled(action->isEnabled());
253
254 if (action->menu()) {
255 if (!action->menu()->platformMenu())
256 action->menu()->setPlatformMenu(platformMenu->createSubMenu());
257 item->setMenu(action->menu()->platformMenu());
258 } else {
259 item->setMenu(nullptr);
260 }
261}
262
263QPlatformMenuItem * QMenuPrivate::insertActionInPlatformMenu(const QAction *action, QPlatformMenuItem *beforeItem)
264{
265 QPlatformMenuItem *menuItem = platformMenu->createMenuItem();
266 Q_ASSERT(menuItem);
267
268 menuItem->setTag(reinterpret_cast<quintptr>(action));
269 QObject::connect(sender: menuItem, signal: &QPlatformMenuItem::activated, receiver: action, slot: &QAction::trigger, type: Qt::QueuedConnection);
270 QObject::connect(sender: menuItem, signal: &QPlatformMenuItem::hovered, receiver: action, slot: &QAction::hovered, type: Qt::QueuedConnection);
271 copyActionToPlatformItem(action, item: menuItem);
272 platformMenu->insertMenuItem(menuItem, before: beforeItem);
273
274 return menuItem;
275}
276
277int QMenuPrivate::scrollerHeight() const
278{
279 Q_Q(const QMenu);
280 return q->style()->pixelMetric(metric: QStyle::PM_MenuScrollerHeight, option: nullptr, widget: q);
281}
282
283// Windows and KDE allow menus to cover the taskbar, while GNOME and macOS
284// don't. Torn-off menus are again different
285inline bool QMenuPrivate::useFullScreenForPopup() const
286{
287 return !tornoff && QStylePrivate::useFullScreenForPopup();
288}
289
290QRect QMenuPrivate::popupGeometry(QScreen *screen) const
291{
292 Q_Q(const QMenu);
293 if (useFullScreenForPopup())
294 return screen ? screen->geometry()
295 : QWidgetPrivate::screenGeometry(widget: q);
296 return screen ? screen->availableGeometry()
297 : QWidgetPrivate::availableScreenGeometry(widget: q);
298}
299
300QList<QPointer<QWidget>> QMenuPrivate::calcCausedStack() const
301{
302 QList<QPointer<QWidget>> ret;
303 for(QWidget *widget = causedPopup.widget; widget; ) {
304 ret.append(t: widget);
305 if (QTornOffMenu *qtmenu = qobject_cast<QTornOffMenu*>(object: widget))
306 ret += qtmenu->d_func()->causedStack;
307 if (QMenu *qmenu = qobject_cast<QMenu*>(object: widget))
308 widget = qmenu->d_func()->causedPopup.widget;
309 else
310 break;
311 }
312 return ret;
313}
314
315bool QMenuPrivate::isContextMenu() const
316{
317#if QT_CONFIG(menubar)
318 return qobject_cast<const QMenuBar *>(object: topCausedWidget()) == nullptr;
319#else
320 return true;
321#endif
322}
323
324void QMenuPrivate::updateActionRects() const
325{
326 updateActionRects(screen: popupGeometry());
327}
328
329void QMenuPrivate::updateActionRects(const QRect &screen) const
330{
331 Q_Q(const QMenu);
332 if (!itemsDirty)
333 return;
334
335 q->ensurePolished();
336
337 //let's reinitialize the buffer
338 actionRects.resize(size: actions.size());
339 actionRects.fill(t: QRect());
340
341 int lastVisibleAction = getLastVisibleAction();
342
343 QStyle *style = q->style();
344 QStyleOption opt;
345 opt.initFrom(w: q);
346 const int hmargin = style->pixelMetric(metric: QStyle::PM_MenuHMargin, option: &opt, widget: q),
347 vmargin = style->pixelMetric(metric: QStyle::PM_MenuVMargin, option: &opt, widget: q),
348 icone = style->pixelMetric(metric: QStyle::PM_SmallIconSize, option: &opt, widget: q);
349 const int fw = style->pixelMetric(metric: QStyle::PM_MenuPanelWidth, option: &opt, widget: q);
350 const int deskFw = style->pixelMetric(metric: QStyle::PM_MenuDesktopFrameWidth, option: &opt, widget: q);
351 const int tearoffHeight = tearoff ? style->pixelMetric(metric: QStyle::PM_MenuTearoffHeight, option: &opt, widget: q) : 0;
352 const int base_y = vmargin + fw + topmargin + (scroll ? scroll->scrollOffset : 0) + tearoffHeight;
353 const int column_max_y = screen.height() - 2 * deskFw - (vmargin + bottommargin + fw);
354 int max_column_width = 0;
355 int y = base_y;
356
357 //for compatibility now - will have to refactor this away
358 tabWidth = 0;
359 maxIconWidth = 0;
360 hasCheckableItems = false;
361 ncols = 1;
362
363 for (int i = 0; i < actions.size(); ++i) {
364 QAction *action = actions.at(i);
365 if (action->isSeparator() || !action->isVisible() || widgetItems.contains(key: action))
366 continue;
367 //..and some members
368 hasCheckableItems |= action->isCheckable();
369 QIcon is = action->icon();
370 if (!is.isNull()) {
371 maxIconWidth = qMax<uint>(a: maxIconWidth, b: icone + 4);
372 }
373 }
374
375 //calculate size
376 QFontMetrics qfm = q->fontMetrics();
377 bool previousWasSeparator = true; // this is true to allow removing the leading separators
378#if QT_CONFIG(shortcut)
379 const bool contextMenu = isContextMenu();
380#endif
381 for(int i = 0; i <= lastVisibleAction; i++) {
382 QAction *action = actions.at(i);
383 const bool isSection = action->isSeparator() && (!action->text().isEmpty() || !action->icon().isNull());
384 const bool isPlainSeparator = (isSection && !q->style()->styleHint(stylehint: QStyle::SH_Menu_SupportsSections))
385 || (action->isSeparator() && !isSection);
386
387 if (!action->isVisible() ||
388 (collapsibleSeparators && previousWasSeparator && isPlainSeparator))
389 continue; // we continue, this action will get an empty QRect
390
391 previousWasSeparator = isPlainSeparator;
392
393 //let the style modify the above size..
394 QStyleOptionMenuItem opt;
395 q->initStyleOption(option: &opt, action);
396 const QFontMetrics &fm = opt.fontMetrics;
397
398 QSize sz;
399 if (QWidget *w = widgetItems.value(key: action)) {
400 sz = w->sizeHint().expandedTo(otherSize: w->minimumSize()).expandedTo(otherSize: w->minimumSizeHint()).boundedTo(otherSize: w->maximumSize());
401 } else {
402 //calc what I think the size is..
403 if (action->isSeparator()) {
404 sz = QSize(2, 2);
405 } else {
406 QString s = action->text();
407 qsizetype t = s.indexOf(c: u'\t');
408 if (t != -1) {
409 tabWidth = qMax(a: int(tabWidth), b: qfm.horizontalAdvance(s.mid(position: t+1)));
410 s = s.left(n: t);
411#if QT_CONFIG(shortcut)
412 } else if (action->isShortcutVisibleInContextMenu() || !contextMenu) {
413 QKeySequence seq = action->shortcut();
414 if (!seq.isEmpty())
415 tabWidth = qMax(a: int(tabWidth), b: qfm.horizontalAdvance(seq.toString(format: QKeySequence::NativeText)));
416#endif
417 }
418 sz.setWidth(fm.boundingRect(r: QRect(), flags: Qt::TextSingleLine | Qt::TextShowMnemonic, text: s).width());
419 sz.setHeight(qMax(a: fm.height(), b: qfm.height()));
420
421 QIcon is = action->icon();
422 if (!is.isNull()) {
423 QSize is_sz = QSize(icone, icone);
424 if (is_sz.height() > sz.height())
425 sz.setHeight(is_sz.height());
426 }
427 }
428 sz = style->sizeFromContents(ct: QStyle::CT_MenuItem, opt: &opt, contentsSize: sz, w: q);
429 }
430
431
432 if (!sz.isEmpty()) {
433 max_column_width = qMax(a: max_column_width, b: sz.width());
434 //wrapping
435 if (!scroll && y + sz.height() > column_max_y) {
436 ncols++;
437 y = base_y;
438 } else {
439 y += sz.height();
440 }
441 //update the item
442 actionRects[i] = QRect(0, 0, sz.width(), sz.height());
443 }
444 }
445
446 max_column_width += tabWidth; //finally add in the tab width
447 if (!tornoff || scroll) { // exclude non-scrollable tear-off menu since the tear-off menu has a fixed size
448 const int sfcMargin = style->sizeFromContents(ct: QStyle::CT_Menu, opt: &opt, contentsSize: QSize(0, 0), w: q).width();
449 const int min_column_width = q->minimumWidth() - (sfcMargin + leftmargin + rightmargin + 2 * (fw + hmargin));
450 max_column_width = qMax(a: min_column_width, b: max_column_width);
451 }
452
453 //calculate position
454 int x = hmargin + fw + leftmargin;
455 y = base_y;
456
457 for(int i = 0; i < actions.size(); i++) {
458 QRect &rect = actionRects[i];
459 if (rect.isNull())
460 continue;
461 if (!scroll && y + rect.height() > column_max_y) {
462 x += max_column_width + hmargin;
463 y = base_y;
464 }
465 rect.translate(dx: x, dy: y); //move
466 rect.setWidth(max_column_width); //uniform width
467
468 //we need to update the widgets geometry
469 if (QWidget *widget = widgetItems.value(key: actions.at(i))) {
470 widget->setGeometry(rect);
471 widget->setVisible(actions.at(i)->isVisible());
472 }
473
474 y += rect.height();
475 }
476 itemsDirty = 0;
477}
478
479int QMenuPrivate::getLastVisibleAction() const
480{
481 //let's try to get the last visible action
482 int lastVisibleAction = actions.size() - 1;
483 for (;lastVisibleAction >= 0; --lastVisibleAction) {
484 const QAction *action = actions.at(i: lastVisibleAction);
485 if (action->isVisible()) {
486 //removing trailing separators
487 if (action->isSeparator() && collapsibleSeparators)
488 continue;
489 break;
490 }
491 }
492 return lastVisibleAction;
493}
494
495
496QRect QMenuPrivate::actionRect(QAction *act) const
497{
498 int index = actions.indexOf(t: act);
499 if (index == -1)
500 return QRect();
501
502 updateActionRects();
503
504 //we found the action
505 return actionRects.at(i: index);
506}
507
508void QMenuPrivate::hideUpToMenuBar()
509{
510 Q_Q(QMenu);
511 bool fadeMenus = q->style()->styleHint(stylehint: QStyle::SH_Menu_FadeOutOnHide);
512 if (!tornoff) {
513 QWidget *caused = causedPopup.widget;
514 hideMenu(menu: q); //hide after getting causedPopup
515 while(caused) {
516#if QT_CONFIG(menubar)
517 if (QMenuBar *mb = qobject_cast<QMenuBar*>(object: caused)) {
518 mb->d_func()->setCurrentAction(nullptr);
519 mb->d_func()->setKeyboardMode(false);
520 caused = nullptr;
521 } else
522#endif
523 if (QMenu *m = qobject_cast<QMenu*>(object: caused)) {
524 caused = m->d_func()->causedPopup.widget;
525 if (!m->d_func()->tornoff)
526 hideMenu(menu: m);
527 if (!fadeMenus) // Mac doesn't clear the action until after hidden.
528 m->d_func()->setCurrentAction(nullptr);
529 } else { caused = nullptr;
530 }
531 }
532 }
533 setCurrentAction(nullptr);
534}
535
536void QMenuPrivate::hideMenu(QMenu *menu)
537{
538 if (!menu)
539 return;
540
541 // See two execs below. They may trigger an akward situation
542 // when 'menu' (also known as 'q' or 'this' in the many functions
543 // around) to become a dangling pointer if the loop manages
544 // to execute 'deferred delete' ... posted while executing
545 // this same loop. Not good!
546 struct Reposter : QObject
547 {
548 Reposter(QMenu *menu) : q(menu)
549 {
550 Q_ASSERT(q);
551 q->installEventFilter(filterObj: this);
552 }
553 ~Reposter()
554 {
555 if (deleteLater)
556 q->deleteLater();
557 }
558 bool eventFilter(QObject *obj, QEvent *event) override
559 {
560 if (obj == q && event->type() == QEvent::DeferredDelete)
561 return deleteLater = true;
562
563 return QObject::eventFilter(watched: obj, event);
564 }
565 QMenu *q = nullptr;
566 bool deleteLater = false;
567 };
568
569#if QT_CONFIG(effects)
570 QSignalBlocker blocker(menu);
571 aboutToHide = true;
572 // Flash item which is about to trigger (if any).
573 if (menu->style()->styleHint(stylehint: QStyle::SH_Menu_FlashTriggeredItem)
574 && currentAction && currentAction == actionAboutToTrigger
575 && menu->actions().contains(t: currentAction)) {
576 QEventLoop eventLoop;
577 QAction *activeAction = currentAction;
578
579 menu->setActiveAction(nullptr);
580 const Reposter deleteDeleteLate(menu);
581 QTimer::singleShot(msec: 60, receiver: &eventLoop, SLOT(quit()));
582 eventLoop.exec();
583
584 // Select and wait 20 ms.
585 menu->setActiveAction(activeAction);
586 QTimer::singleShot(msec: 20, receiver: &eventLoop, SLOT(quit()));
587 eventLoop.exec();
588 }
589
590 aboutToHide = false;
591 blocker.unblock();
592#endif // QT_CONFIG(effects)
593 if (activeMenu == menu)
594 activeMenu = nullptr;
595 menu->d_func()->causedPopup.action = nullptr;
596 menu->close();
597 menu->d_func()->causedPopup.widget = nullptr;
598}
599
600QWindow *QMenuPrivate::transientParentWindow() const
601{
602 Q_Q(const QMenu);
603 if (const QWidget *parent = q->nativeParentWidget()) {
604 if (parent->windowHandle())
605 return parent->windowHandle();
606 }
607
608 if (const QWindow *w = q->windowHandle()) {
609 if (w->transientParent())
610 return w->transientParent();
611 }
612
613 if (causedPopup.widget) {
614 if (const QWidget *w = causedPopup.widget.data()) {
615 if (const QWidget *ww = w->window())
616 return ww->windowHandle();
617 }
618 }
619
620 return nullptr;
621}
622
623void QMenuPrivate::popupAction(QAction *action, int delay, bool activateFirst)
624{
625 Q_Q(QMenu);
626 if (action) {
627 if (action->isEnabled()) {
628 if (!delay)
629 q->internalDelayedPopup();
630 else if (action->menu() && !action->menu()->isVisible())
631 delayState.start(timeout: delay, toStartAction: action);
632 else if (!action->menu())
633 delayState.stop();
634 if (activateFirst && action->menu())
635 action->menu()->d_func()->setFirstActionActive();
636 }
637 } else if (QMenu *menu = activeMenu) { //hide the current item
638 hideMenu(menu);
639 }
640}
641
642void QMenuPrivate::setSyncAction()
643{
644 Q_Q(QMenu);
645 QAction *current = currentAction;
646 if (current && (!current->isEnabled() || current->menu() || current->isSeparator()))
647 current = nullptr;
648 for(QWidget *caused = q; caused;) {
649 if (QMenu *m = qobject_cast<QMenu*>(object: caused)) {
650 caused = m->d_func()->causedPopup.widget;
651 if (m->d_func()->eventLoop)
652 m->d_func()->syncAction = current; // synchronous operation
653 } else {
654 break;
655 }
656 }
657}
658
659
660void QMenuPrivate::setFirstActionActive()
661{
662 Q_Q(QMenu);
663 updateActionRects();
664 for(int i = 0, saccum = 0; i < actions.size(); i++) {
665 const QRect &rect = actionRects.at(i);
666 if (rect.isNull())
667 continue;
668 if (scroll && scroll->scrollFlags & QMenuScroller::ScrollUp) {
669 saccum -= rect.height();
670 if (saccum > scroll->scrollOffset - scrollerHeight())
671 continue;
672 }
673 QAction *act = actions.at(i);
674 if (!act->isSeparator() &&
675 (q->style()->styleHint(stylehint: QStyle::SH_Menu_AllowActiveAndDisabled, opt: nullptr, widget: q)
676 || act->isEnabled())) {
677 setCurrentAction(act);
678 break;
679 }
680 }
681}
682
683// popup == -1 means do not popup, 0 means immediately, others mean use a timer
684void QMenuPrivate::setCurrentAction(QAction *action, int popup, SelectionReason reason, bool activateFirst)
685{
686 Q_Q(QMenu);
687 tearoffHighlighted = 0;
688
689 if (action
690 && (action->isSeparator()
691 || (!action->isEnabled() && !q->style()->styleHint(stylehint: QStyle::SH_Menu_AllowActiveAndDisabled, opt: nullptr, widget: q))))
692 action = nullptr;
693
694 // Reselect the currently active action in case mouse moved over other menu items when
695 // moving from sub menu action to sub menu (QTBUG-20094).
696 if (reason != SelectedFromKeyboard) {
697 if (QMenu *menu = qobject_cast<QMenu*>(object: causedPopup.widget)) {
698 if (causedPopup.action && menu->d_func()->activeMenu == q)
699 // Reselect parent menu action only if mouse is over a menu and parent menu action is not already selected (QTBUG-47987)
700 if (hasReceievedEnter && menu->d_func()->currentAction != causedPopup.action)
701 menu->d_func()->setCurrentAction(action: causedPopup.action, popup: 0, reason, activateFirst: false);
702 }
703 }
704
705 if (currentAction)
706 q->update(actionRect(act: currentAction));
707
708 QMenu *hideActiveMenu = activeMenu;
709 QAction *previousAction = currentAction;
710
711 currentAction = action;
712 if (action) {
713 if (!action->isSeparator()) {
714 activateAction(action, QAction::Hover);
715 if (popup != -1) {
716 // if the menu is visible then activate the required action,
717 // otherwise we just mark the action as currentAction
718 // and activate it when the menu will be popuped.
719 if (q->isVisible())
720 popupAction(action: currentAction, delay: popup, activateFirst);
721 }
722 q->update(actionRect(act: action));
723
724 if (reason == SelectedFromKeyboard) {
725 QWidget *widget = widgetItems.value(key: action);
726 if (widget) {
727 if (widget->focusPolicy() != Qt::NoFocus)
728 widget->setFocus(Qt::TabFocusReason);
729 } else {
730 //when the action has no QWidget, the QMenu itself should
731 // get the focus
732 // Since the menu is a pop-up, it uses the popup reason.
733 if (!q->hasFocus()) {
734 q->setFocus(Qt::PopupFocusReason);
735 }
736 }
737 }
738 }
739#if QT_CONFIG(statustip)
740 } else if (previousAction) {
741 previousAction->d_func()->showStatusText(widget: topCausedWidget(), str: QString());
742#endif
743 }
744 if (hideActiveMenu && previousAction != currentAction) {
745 if (popup == -1) {
746#if QT_CONFIG(effects)
747 // kill any running effect
748 qFadeEffect(nullptr);
749 qScrollEffect(nullptr);
750#endif
751 hideMenu(menu: hideActiveMenu);
752 } else if (!currentAction || !currentAction->menu()) {
753 sloppyState.startTimerIfNotRunning();
754 }
755 }
756}
757
758void QMenuSloppyState::reset()
759{
760 m_enabled = false;
761 m_first_mouse = true;
762 m_init_guard = false;
763 m_use_reset_action = true;
764 m_uni_dir_discarded_count = 0;
765 m_time.stop();
766 m_reset_action = nullptr;
767 m_origin_action = nullptr;
768 m_action_rect = QRect();
769 m_previous_point = QPointF();
770 if (m_sub_menu) {
771 QMenuPrivate::get(m: m_sub_menu)->sloppyState.m_parent = nullptr;
772 m_sub_menu = nullptr;
773 }
774}
775void QMenuSloppyState::enter()
776{
777 QMenuPrivate *menuPriv = QMenuPrivate::get(m: m_menu);
778
779 if (m_discard_state_when_entering_parent && m_sub_menu == menuPriv->activeMenu) {
780 menuPriv->hideMenu(menu: m_sub_menu);
781 reset();
782 }
783 if (m_parent)
784 m_parent->childEnter();
785}
786
787void QMenuSloppyState::childEnter()
788{
789 stopTimer();
790 if (m_parent)
791 m_parent->childEnter();
792}
793
794void QMenuSloppyState::leave()
795{
796 if (!m_dont_start_time_on_leave) {
797 if (m_parent)
798 m_parent->childLeave();
799 startTimerIfNotRunning();
800 }
801}
802
803void QMenuSloppyState::childLeave()
804{
805 if (m_enabled && !QMenuPrivate::get(m: m_menu)->hasReceievedEnter) {
806 startTimerIfNotRunning();
807 if (m_parent)
808 m_parent->childLeave();
809 }
810}
811
812void QMenuSloppyState::setSubMenuPopup(const QRect &actionRect, QAction *resetAction, QMenu *subMenu)
813{
814 m_enabled = true;
815 m_init_guard = true;
816 m_use_reset_action = true;
817 m_time.stop();
818 m_action_rect = actionRect;
819 if (m_sub_menu)
820 QMenuPrivate::get(m: m_sub_menu)->sloppyState.m_parent = nullptr;
821 m_sub_menu = subMenu;
822 QMenuPrivate::get(m: subMenu)->sloppyState.m_parent = this;
823 m_reset_action = resetAction;
824 m_origin_action = resetAction;
825}
826
827bool QMenuSloppyState::hasParentActiveDelayTimer() const
828{
829 return m_parent && m_parent->m_menu && QMenuPrivate::get(m: m_parent->m_menu)->delayState.timer.isActive();
830}
831
832class ResetOnDestroy
833{
834public:
835 ResetOnDestroy(QMenuSloppyState *sloppyState, bool *guard)
836 : toReset(sloppyState)
837 , guard(guard)
838 {
839 *guard = false;
840 }
841
842 ~ResetOnDestroy()
843 {
844 if (!*guard)
845 toReset->reset();
846 }
847
848 QMenuSloppyState *toReset;
849 bool *guard;
850};
851
852void QMenuSloppyState::timeout()
853{
854 QMenuPrivate *menu_priv = QMenuPrivate::get(m: m_menu);
855
856 bool reallyHasMouse = menu_priv->hasReceievedEnter;
857 if (!reallyHasMouse) {
858 // Check whether the menu really has a mouse, because only active popup
859 // menu gets the enter/leave events. Currently Cocoa is an exception.
860 const QPoint lastCursorPos = QGuiApplicationPrivate::lastCursorPosition.toPoint();
861 reallyHasMouse = m_menu->frameGeometry().contains(p: lastCursorPos);
862 }
863
864 if (menu_priv->currentAction == m_reset_action
865 && reallyHasMouse
866 && (menu_priv->currentAction
867 && menu_priv->currentAction->menu() == menu_priv->activeMenu)) {
868 return;
869 }
870
871 ResetOnDestroy resetState(this, &m_init_guard);
872
873 if (hasParentActiveDelayTimer() || !m_menu->isVisible())
874 return;
875
876 if (m_sub_menu)
877 menu_priv->hideMenu(menu: m_sub_menu);
878
879 if (reallyHasMouse) {
880 if (m_use_reset_action)
881 menu_priv->setCurrentAction(action: m_reset_action, popup: 0);
882 } else {
883 menu_priv->setCurrentAction(action: nullptr, popup: 0);
884 }
885}
886
887//return the top causedPopup.widget that is not a QMenu
888QWidget *QMenuPrivate::topCausedWidget() const
889{
890 QWidget* top = causedPopup.widget;
891 while (QMenu* m = qobject_cast<QMenu *>(object: top))
892 top = m->d_func()->causedPopup.widget;
893 return top;
894}
895
896QAction *QMenuPrivate::actionAt(QPoint p) const
897{
898 if (!rect().contains(p)) //sanity check
899 return nullptr;
900
901 for(int i = 0; i < actionRects.size(); i++) {
902 if (actionRects.at(i).contains(p))
903 return actions.at(i);
904 }
905 return nullptr;
906}
907
908void QMenuPrivate::setOverrideMenuAction(QAction *a)
909{
910 Q_Q(QMenu);
911 QObject::disconnect(sender: menuAction, SIGNAL(destroyed()), receiver: q, SLOT(_q_overrideMenuActionDestroyed()));
912 if (a) {
913 menuAction = a;
914 QObject::connect(sender: a, SIGNAL(destroyed()), receiver: q, SLOT(_q_overrideMenuActionDestroyed()));
915 } else { //we revert back to the default action created by the QMenu itself
916 menuAction = defaultMenuAction;
917 }
918}
919
920void QMenuPrivate::_q_overrideMenuActionDestroyed()
921{
922 menuAction=defaultMenuAction;
923}
924
925void QMenuPrivate::updateLayoutDirection()
926{
927 Q_Q(QMenu);
928 //we need to mimic the cause of the popup's layout direction
929 //to allow setting it on a mainwindow for example
930 //we call setLayoutDirection_helper to not overwrite a user-defined value
931 if (!q->testAttribute(attribute: Qt::WA_SetLayoutDirection)) {
932 if (QWidget *w = causedPopup.widget)
933 setLayoutDirection_helper(w->layoutDirection());
934 else if (QWidget *w = q->parentWidget())
935 setLayoutDirection_helper(w->layoutDirection());
936 else
937 setLayoutDirection_helper(QGuiApplication::layoutDirection());
938 }
939}
940
941void QMenuPrivate::drawScroller(QPainter *painter, QMenuPrivate::ScrollerTearOffItem::Type type, const QRect &rect)
942{
943 if (!painter || rect.isEmpty())
944 return;
945
946 if (!scroll || !(scroll->scrollFlags & (QMenuPrivate::QMenuScroller::ScrollUp
947 | QMenuPrivate::QMenuScroller::ScrollDown)))
948 return;
949
950 Q_Q(QMenu);
951 QStyleOptionMenuItem menuOpt;
952 menuOpt.initFrom(w: q);
953 menuOpt.state = QStyle::State_None;
954 menuOpt.checkType = QStyleOptionMenuItem::NotCheckable;
955 menuOpt.maxIconWidth = 0;
956 menuOpt.reservedShortcutWidth = 0;
957 menuOpt.rect = rect;
958 menuOpt.menuItemType = QStyleOptionMenuItem::Scroller;
959 menuOpt.state |= QStyle::State_Enabled;
960 if (type == QMenuPrivate::ScrollerTearOffItem::ScrollDown)
961 menuOpt.state |= QStyle::State_DownArrow;
962
963 painter->setClipRect(menuOpt.rect);
964 q->style()->drawControl(element: QStyle::CE_MenuScroller, opt: &menuOpt, p: painter, w: q);
965}
966
967void QMenuPrivate::drawTearOff(QPainter *painter, const QRect &rect)
968{
969 if (!painter || rect.isEmpty())
970 return;
971
972 if (!tearoff)
973 return;
974
975 Q_Q(QMenu);
976 QStyleOptionMenuItem menuOpt;
977 menuOpt.initFrom(w: q);
978 menuOpt.state = QStyle::State_None;
979 menuOpt.checkType = QStyleOptionMenuItem::NotCheckable;
980 menuOpt.maxIconWidth = 0;
981 menuOpt.reservedShortcutWidth = 0;
982 menuOpt.rect = rect;
983 menuOpt.menuItemType = QStyleOptionMenuItem::TearOff;
984 if (tearoffHighlighted)
985 menuOpt.state |= QStyle::State_Selected;
986
987 painter->setClipRect(menuOpt.rect);
988 q->style()->drawControl(element: QStyle::CE_MenuTearoff, opt: &menuOpt, p: painter, w: q);
989}
990
991QRect QMenuPrivate::rect() const
992{
993 Q_Q(const QMenu);
994 QStyle *style = q->style();
995 QStyleOption opt(0);
996 opt.initFrom(w: q);
997 const int hmargin = style->pixelMetric(metric: QStyle::PM_MenuHMargin, option: &opt, widget: q);
998 const int vmargin = style->pixelMetric(metric: QStyle::PM_MenuVMargin, option: &opt, widget: q);
999 const int fw = style->pixelMetric(metric: QStyle::PM_MenuPanelWidth, option: &opt, widget: q);
1000 return (q->rect().adjusted(xp1: hmargin + fw + leftmargin, yp1: vmargin + fw + topmargin,
1001 xp2: -(hmargin + fw + rightmargin), yp2: -(vmargin + fw + bottommargin)));
1002}
1003
1004QMenuPrivate::ScrollerTearOffItem::ScrollerTearOffItem(QMenuPrivate::ScrollerTearOffItem::Type type, QMenuPrivate *mPrivate, QWidget *parent, Qt::WindowFlags f)
1005 : QWidget(parent, f), menuPrivate(mPrivate), scrollType(type)
1006{
1007 if (parent)
1008 setMouseTracking(parent->style()->styleHint(stylehint: QStyle::SH_Menu_MouseTracking, opt: nullptr, widget: parent));
1009}
1010
1011void QMenuPrivate::ScrollerTearOffItem::paintEvent(QPaintEvent *e)
1012{
1013 if (!e->rect().intersects(r: rect()))
1014 return;
1015
1016 QPainter p(this);
1017 QWidget *parent = parentWidget();
1018
1019 //paint scroll up / down arrows
1020 menuPrivate->drawScroller(painter: &p, type: scrollType, rect: QRect(0, 0, width(), menuPrivate->scrollerHeight()));
1021 //paint the tear off
1022 if (scrollType == QMenuPrivate::ScrollerTearOffItem::ScrollUp) {
1023 QRect rect(0, 0, width(), parent->style()->pixelMetric(metric: QStyle::PM_MenuTearoffHeight, option: nullptr, widget: parent));
1024 if (menuPrivate->scroll && menuPrivate->scroll->scrollFlags & QMenuPrivate::QMenuScroller::ScrollUp)
1025 rect.translate(dx: 0, dy: menuPrivate->scrollerHeight());
1026 menuPrivate->drawTearOff(painter: &p, rect);
1027 }
1028}

1036 raise();
1037 setVisible(true);
1038 }

1097
1098//actually performs the scrolling
1099void QMenuPrivate::scrollMenu(QAction *action, QMenuScroller::ScrollLocation location, bool active)
1100{
1101 Q_Q(QMenu);
1102 if (!scroll || !scroll->scrollFlags)
1103 return;
1104 updateActionRects();
1105 int newOffset = 0;
1106 const int topScroll = (scroll->scrollFlags & QMenuScroller::ScrollUp) ? scrollerHeight() : 0;
1107 const int botScroll = (scroll->scrollFlags & QMenuScroller::ScrollDown) ? scrollerHeight() : 0;
1108 const int vmargin = q->style()->pixelMetric(metric: QStyle::PM_MenuVMargin, option: nullptr, widget: q);
1109 const int fw = q->style()->pixelMetric(metric: QStyle::PM_MenuPanelWidth, option: nullptr, widget: q);
1110
1111 if (location == QMenuScroller::ScrollTop) {
1112 for(int i = 0, saccum = 0; i < actions.size(); i++) {
1113 if (actions.at(i) == action) {
1114 newOffset = topScroll - saccum;
1115 break;
1116 }
1117 saccum += actionRects.at(i).height();
1118 }
1119 } else {
1120 for(int i = 0, saccum = 0; i < actions.size(); i++) {
1121 saccum += actionRects.at(i).height();
1122 if (actions.at(i) == action) {
1123 if (location == QMenuScroller::ScrollCenter)
1124 newOffset = ((q->height() / 2) - botScroll) - (saccum - topScroll);
1125 else
1126 newOffset = (q->height() - botScroll) - saccum;
1127 break;
1128 }
1129 }
1130 if (newOffset)
1131 newOffset -= fw * 2;
1132 }
1133
1134 //figure out which scroll flags
1135 uint newScrollFlags = QMenuScroller::ScrollNone;
1136 if (newOffset < 0) //easy and cheap one
1137 newScrollFlags |= QMenuScroller::ScrollUp;
1138 int saccum = newOffset;
1139 for(int i = 0; i < actionRects.size(); i++) {
1140 saccum += actionRects.at(i).height();
1141 if (saccum > q->height()) {
1142 newScrollFlags |= QMenuScroller::ScrollDown;
1143 break;
1144 }
1145 }
1146
1147 if (!(newScrollFlags & QMenuScroller::ScrollDown) && (scroll->scrollFlags & QMenuScroller::ScrollDown)) {
1148 newOffset = q->height() - (saccum - newOffset) - fw*2 - vmargin - topmargin - bottommargin; //last item at bottom
1149 if (tearoff)
1150 newOffset -= q->style()->pixelMetric(metric: QStyle::PM_MenuTearoffHeight, option: nullptr, widget: q);
1151 }
1152
1153 if (!(newScrollFlags & QMenuScroller::ScrollUp) && (scroll->scrollFlags & QMenuScroller::ScrollUp)) {
1154 newOffset = 0; //first item at top
1155 }
1156
1157 if (newScrollFlags & QMenuScroller::ScrollUp)
1158 newOffset -= vmargin;
1159
1160 QRect screen = popupGeometry();
1161 const int desktopFrame = q->style()->pixelMetric(metric: QStyle::PM_MenuDesktopFrameWidth, option: nullptr, widget: q);
1162 if (q->height() < screen.height()-(desktopFrame*2)-1) {
1163 QRect geom = q->geometry();
1164 if (newOffset > scroll->scrollOffset && (scroll->scrollFlags & newScrollFlags & QMenuScroller::ScrollUp)) { //scroll up
1165 const int newHeight = geom.height()-(newOffset-scroll->scrollOffset);
1166 if (newHeight > geom.height())
1167 geom.setHeight(newHeight);
1168 } else if (scroll->scrollFlags & newScrollFlags & QMenuScroller::ScrollDown) {
1169 int newTop = geom.top() + (newOffset-scroll->scrollOffset);
1170 if (newTop < desktopFrame+screen.top())
1171 newTop = desktopFrame+screen.top();
1172 if (newTop < geom.top()) {
1173 geom.setTop(newTop);
1174 newOffset = 0;
1175 newScrollFlags &= ~QMenuScroller::ScrollUp;
1176 }
1177 }
1178 if (geom.bottom() > screen.bottom() - desktopFrame)
1179 geom.setBottom(screen.bottom() - desktopFrame);
1180 if (geom.top() < desktopFrame+screen.top())
1181 geom.setTop(desktopFrame+screen.top());
1182 if (geom != q->geometry()) {
1183#if 0
1184 if (newScrollFlags & QMenuScroller::ScrollDown &&
1185 q->geometry().top() - geom.top() >= -newOffset)
1186 newScrollFlags &= ~QMenuScroller::ScrollDown;
1187#endif
1188 q->setGeometry(geom);
1189 }
1190 }
1191
1192 //actually update flags
1193 const int delta = qMin(a: 0, b: newOffset) - scroll->scrollOffset; //make sure the new offset is always negative
1194 if (!itemsDirty && delta) {
1195 //we've scrolled so we need to update the action rects
1196 for (int i = 0; i < actionRects.size(); ++i) {
1197 QRect &current = actionRects[i];
1198 current.moveTop(pos: current.top() + delta);
1199
1200 //we need to update the widgets geometry
1201 if (QWidget *w = widgetItems.value(key: actions.at(i)))
1202 w->setGeometry(current);
1203 }
1204 }
1205 scroll->scrollOffset += delta;
1206 scroll->scrollFlags = newScrollFlags;
1207 if (active)
1208 setCurrentAction(action);
1209
1210 q->update(); //issue an update so we see all the new state..
1211}
1212
1213void QMenuPrivate::scrollMenu(QMenuScroller::ScrollLocation location, bool active)
1214{
1215 Q_Q(QMenu);
1216 updateActionRects();
1217 if (location == QMenuScroller::ScrollBottom) {
1218 for(int i = actions.size()-1; i >= 0; --i) {
1219 QAction *act = actions.at(i);
1220 if (actionRects.at(i).isNull())
1221 continue;
1222 if (!act->isSeparator() &&
1223 (q->style()->styleHint(stylehint: QStyle::SH_Menu_AllowActiveAndDisabled, opt: nullptr, widget: q)
1224 || act->isEnabled())) {
1225 if (scroll->scrollFlags & QMenuPrivate::QMenuScroller::ScrollDown)
1226 scrollMenu(action: act, location: QMenuPrivate::QMenuScroller::ScrollBottom, active);
1227 else if (active)
1228 setCurrentAction(action: act, /*popup*/-1, reason: QMenuPrivate::SelectedFromKeyboard);
1229 break;
1230 }
1231 }
1232 } else if (location == QMenuScroller::ScrollTop) {
1233 for(int i = 0; i < actions.size(); ++i) {
1234 QAction *act = actions.at(i);
1235 if (actionRects.at(i).isNull())
1236 continue;
1237 if (!act->isSeparator() &&
1238 (q->style()->styleHint(stylehint: QStyle::SH_Menu_AllowActiveAndDisabled, opt: nullptr, widget: q)
1239 || act->isEnabled())) {
1240 if (scroll->scrollFlags & QMenuPrivate::QMenuScroller::ScrollUp)
1241 scrollMenu(action: act, location: QMenuPrivate::QMenuScroller::ScrollTop, active);
1242 else if (active)
1243 setCurrentAction(action: act, /*popup*/-1, reason: QMenuPrivate::SelectedFromKeyboard);
1244 break;
1245 }
1246 }
1247 }
1248}
1249
1250//only directional
1251void QMenuPrivate::scrollMenu(QMenuScroller::ScrollDirection direction, bool page, bool active)
1252{
1253 Q_Q(QMenu);
1254 if (!scroll || !(scroll->scrollFlags & direction)) //not really possible...
1255 return;
1256 updateActionRects();
1257 const int topScroll = (scroll->scrollFlags & QMenuScroller::ScrollUp) ? scrollerHeight() : 0;
1258 const int botScroll = (scroll->scrollFlags & QMenuScroller::ScrollDown) ? scrollerHeight() : 0;
1259 const int vmargin = q->style()->pixelMetric(metric: QStyle::PM_MenuVMargin, option: nullptr, widget: q);
1260 const int fw = q->style()->pixelMetric(metric: QStyle::PM_MenuPanelWidth, option: nullptr, widget: q);
1261 const int offset = topScroll ? topScroll-vmargin : 0;
1262 if (direction == QMenuScroller::ScrollUp) {
1263 for(int i = 0, saccum = 0; i < actions.size(); i++) {
1264 saccum -= actionRects.at(i).height();
1265 if (saccum <= scroll->scrollOffset-offset) {
1266 scrollMenu(action: actions.at(i), location: page ? QMenuScroller::ScrollBottom : QMenuScroller::ScrollTop, active);
1267 break;
1268 }
1269 }
1270 } else if (direction == QMenuScroller::ScrollDown) {
1271 bool scrolled = false;
1272 for(int i = 0, saccum = 0; i < actions.size(); i++) {
1273 const int iHeight = actionRects.at(i).height();
1274 saccum -= iHeight;
1275 if (saccum <= scroll->scrollOffset-offset) {
1276 const int scrollerArea = q->height() - botScroll - fw*2;
1277 int visible = (scroll->scrollOffset-offset) - saccum;
1278 for(i++ ; i < actions.size(); i++) {
1279 visible += actionRects.at(i).height();
1280 if (visible > scrollerArea - topScroll) {
1281 scrolled = true;
1282 scrollMenu(action: actions.at(i), location: page ? QMenuScroller::ScrollTop : QMenuScroller::ScrollBottom, active);
1283 break;
1284 }
1285 }
1286 break;
1287 }
1288 }
1289 if (!scrolled) {
1290 scroll->scrollFlags &= ~QMenuScroller::ScrollDown;
1291 q->update();
1292 }
1293 }
1294}
1295
1296/* This is poor-mans eventfilters. This avoids the use of
1297 eventFilter (which can be nasty for users of QMenuBar's). */
1298bool QMenuPrivate::mouseEventTaken(QMouseEvent *e)
1299{
1300 Q_Q(QMenu);
1301 QPoint pos = q->mapFromGlobal(e->globalPosition().toPoint());
1302
1303 QStyle *style = q->style();
1304 QStyleOption opt(0);
1305 opt.initFrom(w: q);
1306 const int hmargin = style->pixelMetric(metric: QStyle::PM_MenuHMargin, option: &opt, widget: q);
1307 const int vmargin = style->pixelMetric(metric: QStyle::PM_MenuVMargin, option: &opt, widget: q);
1308 const int fw = style->pixelMetric(metric: QStyle::PM_MenuPanelWidth, option: &opt, widget: q);
1309
1310 if (scroll && !activeMenu) { //let the scroller "steal" the event
1311 bool isScroll = false;
1312 if (pos.x() >= 0 && pos.x() < q->width()) {
1313 for (int dir = QMenuScroller::ScrollUp; dir <= QMenuScroller::ScrollDown; dir = dir << 1) {
1314 if (scroll->scrollFlags & dir) {
1315 if (dir == QMenuScroller::ScrollUp)
1316 isScroll = (pos.y() <= scrollerHeight() + fw + vmargin + topmargin);
1317 else if (dir == QMenuScroller::ScrollDown)
1318 isScroll = (pos.y() >= q->height() - scrollerHeight() - fw - vmargin - bottommargin);
1319 if (isScroll) {
1320 scroll->scrollDirection = dir;
1321 break;
1322 }
1323 }
1324 }
1325 }
1326 if (isScroll) {
1327 scroll->scrollTimer.start(msec: 50, obj: q);
1328 return true;
1329 } else {
1330 scroll->scrollTimer.stop();
1331 }
1332 }
1333
1334 if (tearoff) { //let the tear off thingie "steal" the event..
1335 QRect tearRect(leftmargin + hmargin + fw, topmargin + vmargin + fw, q->width() - fw * 2 - hmargin * 2 -leftmargin - rightmargin,
1336 q->style()->pixelMetric(metric: QStyle::PM_MenuTearoffHeight, option: &opt, widget: q));
1337 if (scroll && scroll->scrollFlags & QMenuPrivate::QMenuScroller::ScrollUp)
1338 tearRect.translate(dx: 0, dy: scrollerHeight());
1339 q->update(tearRect);
1340 if (tearRect.contains(p: pos) && hasMouseMoved(globalPos: e->globalPosition().toPoint())) {
1341 setCurrentAction(action: nullptr);
1342 tearoffHighlighted = 1;
1343 if (e->type() == QEvent::MouseButtonRelease) {
1344 if (!tornPopup)
1345 tornPopup = new QTornOffMenu(q);
1346 tornPopup->setGeometry(q->geometry());
1347 tornPopup->show();
1348 hideUpToMenuBar();
1349 }
1350 return true;
1351 }
1352 tearoffHighlighted = 0;
1353 }
1354
1355 if (q->frameGeometry().contains(p: e->globalPosition().toPoint()))
1356 return false; //otherwise if the event is in our rect we want it..
1357
1358 for(QWidget *caused = causedPopup.widget; caused;) {
1359 bool passOnEvent = false;
1360 QWidget *next_widget = nullptr;
1361 QPointF cpos = caused->mapFromGlobal(e->globalPosition());
1362#if QT_CONFIG(menubar)
1363 if (QMenuBar *mb = qobject_cast<QMenuBar*>(object: caused)) {
1364 passOnEvent = mb->rect().contains(p: cpos.toPoint());
1365 } else
1366#endif
1367 if (QMenu *m = qobject_cast<QMenu*>(object: caused)) {
1368 passOnEvent = m->rect().contains(p: cpos.toPoint());
1369 next_widget = m->d_func()->causedPopup.widget;
1370 }
1371 if (passOnEvent) {
1372 if (e->type() != QEvent::MouseButtonRelease || mouseDown == caused) {
1373 QMouseEvent new_e(e->type(), cpos, caused->mapTo(caused->topLevelWidget(), cpos), e->globalPosition(),
1374 e->button(), e->buttons(), e->modifiers(),
1375 e->source(), e->pointingDevice());
1376 QCoreApplication::sendEvent(receiver: caused, event: &new_e);
1377 return true;
1378 }
1379 }
1380 caused = next_widget;
1381 if (!caused)
1382 sloppyState.leave(); // Start timers
1383 }
1384 return false;
1385}
1386
1387void QMenuPrivate::activateCausedStack(const QList<QPointer<QWidget>> &causedStack, QAction *action,
1388 QAction::ActionEvent action_e, bool self)
1389{
1390 Q_Q(QMenu);
1391 // can't use QBoolBlocker here
1392 const bool activationRecursionGuardReset = activationRecursionGuard;
1393 activationRecursionGuard = true;
1394 QPointer<QMenu> guard(q);
1395 if (self)
1396 action->activate(event: action_e);
1397 if (!guard)
1398 return;
1399 auto boolBlocker = qScopeGuard(f: [this, activationRecursionGuardReset]{
1400 activationRecursionGuard = activationRecursionGuardReset;
1401 });
1402
1403 for(int i = 0; i < causedStack.size(); ++i) {
1404 QPointer<QWidget> widget = causedStack.at(i);
1405 if (!widget)
1406 continue;
1407 //fire
1408 if (QMenu *qmenu = qobject_cast<QMenu*>(object: widget)) {
1409 widget = qmenu->d_func()->causedPopup.widget;
1410 if (action_e == QAction::Trigger) {
1411 emit qmenu->triggered(action);
1412 } else if (action_e == QAction::Hover) {
1413 emit qmenu->hovered(action);
1414 }
1415#if QT_CONFIG(menubar)
1416 } else if (QMenuBar *qmenubar = qobject_cast<QMenuBar*>(object: widget)) {
1417 if (action_e == QAction::Trigger) {
1418 emit qmenubar->triggered(action);
1419 } else if (action_e == QAction::Hover) {
1420 emit qmenubar->hovered(action);
1421 }
1422 break; //nothing more..
1423#endif
1424 }
1425 }
1426}
1427
1428void QMenuPrivate::activateAction(QAction *action, QAction::ActionEvent action_e, bool self)
1429{
1430 Q_Q(QMenu);
1431#if QT_CONFIG(whatsthis)
1432 bool inWhatsThisMode = QWhatsThis::inWhatsThisMode();
1433#endif
1434 if (!action || !q->isEnabled()
1435 || (action_e == QAction::Trigger
1436#if QT_CONFIG(whatsthis)
1437 && !inWhatsThisMode
1438#endif
1439 && (action->isSeparator() ||!action->isEnabled())))
1440 return;
1441
1442 /* I have to save the caused stack here because it will be undone after popup execution (ie in the hide).
1443 Then I iterate over the list to actually send the events. --Sam
1444 */
1445 const QList<QPointer<QWidget>> causedStack = calcCausedStack();
1446 if (action_e == QAction::Trigger) {
1447#if QT_CONFIG(whatsthis)
1448 if (!inWhatsThisMode)
1449 actionAboutToTrigger = action;
1450#endif
1451
1452 if (q->testAttribute(attribute: Qt::WA_DontShowOnScreen)) {
1453 hideUpToMenuBar();
1454 } else {
1455 for(QWidget *widget = QApplication::activePopupWidget(); widget; ) {
1456 if (QMenu *qmenu = qobject_cast<QMenu*>(object: widget)) {
1457 if (qmenu == q)
1458 hideUpToMenuBar();
1459 widget = qmenu->d_func()->causedPopup.widget;
1460 } else {
1461 break;
1462 }
1463 }
1464 }
1465
1466#if QT_CONFIG(whatsthis)
1467 if (inWhatsThisMode) {
1468 QString s = action->whatsThis();
1469 if (s.isEmpty())
1470 s = whatsThis;
1471 QWhatsThis::showText(pos: q->mapToGlobal(actionRect(act: action).center()), text: s, w: q);
1472 return;
1473 }
1474#endif
1475 }
1476
1477 QPointer<QMenu> thisGuard(q);
1478 activateCausedStack(causedStack, action, action_e, self);
1479 if (!thisGuard)
1480 return;
1481
1482 if (action_e == QAction::Hover) {
1483#if QT_CONFIG(accessibility)
1484 if (QAccessible::isActive()) {
1485 int actionIndex = indexOf(act: action);
1486 QAccessibleEvent focusEvent(q, QAccessible::Focus);
1487 focusEvent.setChild(actionIndex);
1488 QAccessible::updateAccessibility(event: &focusEvent);
1489 }
1490#endif
1491 action->showStatusText(object: topCausedWidget());
1492 } else {
1493 actionAboutToTrigger = nullptr;
1494 }
1495}
1496
1497void QMenuPrivate::_q_actionTriggered()
1498{
1499 Q_Q(QMenu);
1500 if (QAction *action = qobject_cast<QAction *>(object: q->sender())) {
1501 QPointer<QAction> actionGuard = action;
1502 if (platformMenu && widgetItems.value(key: action))
1503 platformMenu->dismiss();
1504 emit q->triggered(action);
1505 if (!activationRecursionGuard && actionGuard) {
1506 //in case the action has not been activated by the mouse
1507 //we check the parent hierarchy
1508 QList<QPointer<QWidget>> list;
1509 for(QWidget *widget = q->parentWidget(); widget; ) {
1510 if (qobject_cast<QMenu*>(object: widget)
1511#if QT_CONFIG(menubar)
1512 || qobject_cast<QMenuBar*>(object: widget)
1513#endif
1514 ) {
1515 list.append(t: widget);
1516 widget = widget->parentWidget();
1517 } else {
1518 break;
1519 }
1520 }
1521 activateCausedStack(causedStack: list, action, action_e: QAction::Trigger, self: false);
1522 // if a widget action fires, we need to hide the menu explicitly
1523 if (qobject_cast<QWidgetAction*>(object: action))
1524 hideUpToMenuBar();
1525 }
1526 }
1527}
1528
1529void QMenuPrivate::_q_actionHovered()
1530{
1531 Q_Q(QMenu);
1532 if (QAction * action = qobject_cast<QAction *>(object: q->sender())) {
1533 emit q->hovered(action);
1534 }
1535}
1536
1537void QMenuPrivate::_q_platformMenuAboutToShow()
1538{
1539 Q_Q(QMenu);
1540
1541 emit q->aboutToShow();
1542
1543#ifdef Q_OS_MACOS
1544 if (platformMenu) {
1545 const auto actions = q->actions();
1546 for (QAction *action : actions) {
1547 if (QWidget *widget = widgetItems.value(action))
1548 if (widget->parent() == q) {
1549 QPlatformMenuItem *menuItem = platformMenu->menuItemForTag(reinterpret_cast<quintptr>(action));
1550 moveWidgetToPlatformItem(widget, menuItem);
1551 platformMenu->syncMenuItem(menuItem);
1552 }
1553 }
1554 }
1555#endif
1556}
1557
1558bool QMenuPrivate::hasMouseMoved(const QPoint &globalPos)
1559{
1560 //determines if the mouse has moved (ie its initial position has
1561 //changed by more than QApplication::startDragDistance()
1562 //or if there were at least 6 mouse motions)
1563 return motions > 6 ||
1564 QApplication::startDragDistance() < (mousePopupPos - globalPos).manhattanLength();
1565}
1566
1567
1568/*!
1569 Initialize \a option with the values from this menu and information from \a action. This method
1570 is useful for subclasses when they need a QStyleOptionMenuItem, but don't want
1571 to fill in all the information themselves.
1572
1573 \sa QStyleOption::initFrom(), QMenuBar::initStyleOption()
1574*/
1575void QMenu::initStyleOption(QStyleOptionMenuItem *option, const QAction *action) const
1576{
1577 if (!option || !action)
1578 return;
1579
1580 Q_D(const QMenu);
1581 option->initFrom(w: this);
1582 option->palette = palette();
1583 option->state = QStyle::State_None;
1584
1585 if (window()->isActiveWindow())
1586 option->state |= QStyle::State_Active;
1587 if (isEnabled() && action->isEnabled()
1588 && (!action->menu() || action->menu()->isEnabled()))
1589 option->state |= QStyle::State_Enabled;
1590 else
1591 option->palette.setCurrentColorGroup(QPalette::Disabled);
1592
1593 option->font = action->font().resolve(font());
1594 option->fontMetrics = QFontMetrics(option->font);
1595
1596 if (d->currentAction && d->currentAction == action && !d->currentAction->isSeparator()) {
1597 option->state |= QStyle::State_Selected
1598 | (QMenuPrivate::mouseDown ? QStyle::State_Sunken : QStyle::State_None);
1599 }
1600
1601 option->menuHasCheckableItems = d->hasCheckableItems;
1602 if (!action->isCheckable()) {
1603 option->checkType = QStyleOptionMenuItem::NotCheckable;
1604 } else {
1605 option->checkType = (action->actionGroup() && action->actionGroup()->isExclusive())
1606 ? QStyleOptionMenuItem::Exclusive : QStyleOptionMenuItem::NonExclusive;
1607 option->checked = action->isChecked();
1608 }
1609 if (action->menu())
1610 option->menuItemType = QStyleOptionMenuItem::SubMenu;
1611 else if (action->isSeparator())
1612 option->menuItemType = QStyleOptionMenuItem::Separator;
1613 else if (d->defaultAction == action)
1614 option->menuItemType = QStyleOptionMenuItem::DefaultItem;
1615 else
1616 option->menuItemType = QStyleOptionMenuItem::Normal;
1617 if (action->isIconVisibleInMenu())
1618 option->icon = action->icon();
1619 QString textAndAccel = action->text();
1620#ifndef QT_NO_SHORTCUT
1621 if ((action->isShortcutVisibleInContextMenu() || !d->isContextMenu())
1622 && textAndAccel.indexOf(c: u'\t') == -1) {
1623 QKeySequence seq = action->shortcut();
1624 if (!seq.isEmpty())
1625 textAndAccel += u'\t' + seq.toString(format: QKeySequence::NativeText);
1626 }
1627#endif
1628 option->text = textAndAccel;
1629 option->reservedShortcutWidth = d->tabWidth;
1630 option->maxIconWidth = d->maxIconWidth;
1631 option->menuRect = rect();
1632}
1633
1634/*!
1635 \class QMenu
1636 \brief The QMenu class provides a menu widget for use in menu
1637 bars, context menus, and other popup menus.
1638
1639 \ingroup mainwindow-classes
1640 \ingroup basicwidgets
1641 \inmodule QtWidgets
1642
1643 \image fusion-menu.png
1644
1645 A menu widget is a selection menu. It can be either a pull-down
1646 menu in a menu bar or a standalone context menu. Pull-down menus
1647 are shown by the menu bar when the user clicks on the respective
1648 item or presses the specified shortcut key. Use
1649 QMenuBar::addMenu() to insert a menu into a menu bar. Context
1650 menus are usually invoked by some special keyboard key or by
1651 right-clicking. They can be executed either asynchronously with
1652 popup() or synchronously with exec(). Menus can also be invoked in
1653 response to button presses; these are just like context menus
1654 except for how they are invoked.
1655
1656 \section1 Actions
1657
1658 A menu consists of a list of action items. Actions are added with
1659 the addAction(), addActions() and insertAction() functions. An action
1660 is represented vertically and rendered by QStyle. In addition, actions
1661 can have a text label, an optional icon drawn on the very left side,
1662 and shortcut key sequence such as "Ctrl+X".
1663
1664 The existing actions held by a menu can be found with actions().
1665
1666 There are four kinds of action items: separators, actions that
1667 show a submenu, widgets, and actions that perform an action.
1668 Separators are inserted with addSeparator(), submenus with addMenu(),
1669 and all other items are considered action items.
1670
1671 When inserting action items you usually specify a receiver and a
1672 slot. The receiver will be notified whenever the item is
1673 \l{QAction::triggered()}{triggered()}. In addition, QMenu provides
1674 two signals, triggered() and hovered(), which signal the
1675 QAction that was triggered from the menu.
1676
1677 You clear a menu with clear() and remove individual action items
1678 with removeAction().
1679
1680 A QMenu can also provide a tear-off menu. A tear-off menu is a
1681 top-level window that contains a copy of the menu. This makes it
1682 possible for the user to "tear off" frequently used menus and
1683 position them in a convenient place on the screen. If you want
1684 this functionality for a particular menu, insert a tear-off handle
1685 with setTearOffEnabled(). When using tear-off menus, bear in mind
1686 that the concept isn't typically used on Microsoft Windows so
1687 some users may not be familiar with it. Consider using a QToolBar
1688 instead.
1689
1690 Widgets can be inserted into menus with the QWidgetAction class.
1691 Instances of this class are used to hold widgets, and are inserted
1692 into menus with the addAction() overload that takes a QAction. If the
1693 QWidgetAction fires the triggered() signal, the menu will close.
1694
1695 \warning To make QMenu visible on the screen, exec() or popup() should be
1696 used instead of show() or setVisible(). To hide or disable the menu in the
1697 menubar, or in another menu to which it was added as a submenu, use the
1698 respective properties of menuAction() instead.
1699
1700 \section1 QMenu on \macos with Qt Build Against Cocoa
1701
1702 QMenu can be inserted only once in a menu/menubar. Subsequent insertions will
1703 have no effect or will result in a disabled menu item.
1704
1705 See the \l{mainwindows/menus}{Menus} example for an example of how
1706 to use QMenuBar and QMenu in your application.
1707
1708 \b{Important inherited functions:} addAction(), removeAction(), clear(),
1709 addSeparator(), and addMenu().
1710
1711 \sa QMenuBar, {Qt Widgets - Application Example}, {Menus Example}
1712*/
1713
1714
1715/*!
1716 Constructs a menu with parent \a parent.
1717
1718 Although a popup menu is always a top-level widget, if a parent is
1719 passed the popup menu will be deleted when that parent is
1720 destroyed (as with any other QObject).
1721*/
1722QMenu::QMenu(QWidget *parent)
1723 : QWidget(*new QMenuPrivate, parent, Qt::Popup)
1724{
1725 Q_D(QMenu);
1726 d->init();
1727}

1730 Constructs a menu with a \a title and a \a parent.

1733 passed the popup menu will be deleted when that parent is
1734 destroyed (as with any other QObject).
1735
1736 \sa title
1737*/
1738QMenu::QMenu(const QString &title, QWidget *parent)
1739 : QMenu(parent)
1740{
1741 Q_D(QMenu);
1742 d->menuAction->setText(title);
1743}
1744
1745/*! \internal
1746 */
1747QMenu::QMenu(QMenuPrivate &dd, QWidget *parent)
1748 : QWidget(dd, parent, Qt::Popup)
1749{
1750 Q_D(QMenu);
1751 d->init();
1752}
1753
1754/*!
1755 Destroys the menu.
1756*/
1757QMenu::~QMenu()
1758{
1759 Q_D(QMenu);
1760 if (!d->widgetItems.isEmpty()) { // avoid detach on shared null hash
1761 QHash<QAction *, QWidget *>::iterator it = d->widgetItems.begin();
1762 for (; it != d->widgetItems.end(); ++it) {
1763 if (QWidget *widget = it.value()) {
1764 QWidgetAction *action = static_cast<QWidgetAction *>(it.key());
1765 action->releaseWidget(widget);
1766 *it = 0;
1767 }
1768 }
1769 }
1770
1771 if (d->eventLoop)
1772 d->eventLoop->exit();
1773 hideTearOffMenu();
1774}

1952
1953/*!
1954 This convenience function inserts \a menu before action \a before
1955 and returns the menus menuAction().
1956
1957 \sa QWidget::insertAction(), addMenu()
1958*/
1959QAction *QMenu::insertMenu(QAction *before, QMenu *menu)
1960{
1961 QAction *action = menu->menuAction();
1962 insertAction(before, action);
1963 return action;
1964}

2055/*!
2056 \property QMenu::tearOffEnabled
2057 \brief whether the menu supports being torn off
2058
2059 When true, the menu contains a special tear-off item (often shown as a dashed
2060 line at the top of the menu) that creates a copy of the menu when it is
2061 triggered.
2062
2063 This "torn-off" copy lives in a separate window. It contains the same menu
2064 items as the original menu, with the exception of the tear-off handle.
2065
2066 By default, this property is \c false.
2067*/
2068void QMenu::setTearOffEnabled(bool b)
2069{
2070 Q_D(QMenu);
2071 if (d->tearoff == b)
2072 return;
2073 if (!b)
2074 hideTearOffMenu();
2075 d->tearoff = b;
2076
2077 d->itemsDirty = true;
2078 if (isVisible())
2079 resize(sizeHint());
2080}
2081
2082bool QMenu::isTearOffEnabled() const
2083{
2084 return d_func()->tearoff;
2085}

2087/*!
2088 When a menu is torn off a second menu is shown to display the menu
2089 contents in a new window. When the menu is in this mode and the menu
2090 is visible returns \c true; otherwise false.
2091
2092 \sa showTearOffMenu(), hideTearOffMenu(), isTearOffEnabled()
2093*/
2094bool QMenu::isTearOffMenuVisible() const
2095{
2096 if (d_func()->tornPopup)
2097 return d_func()->tornPopup->isVisible();
2098 return false;
2099}

2113 d->tornPopup = new QTornOffMenu(this);
2114 const QSize &s = sizeHint();
2115 d->tornPopup->setGeometry(ax: pos.x(), ay: pos.y(), aw: s.width(), ah: s.height());
2116 d->tornPopup->show();
2117}

2139void QMenu::hideTearOffMenu()
2140{

2143 d->tornPopup->close();

2145 // should consider the torn-off menu deleted.

2187 const QAction *action = actions().at(i);

2189 ret = false;

2206 removeAction(action: acts[i]);
2207 if (acts[i]->parent() == this && acts[i]->d_func()->associatedObjects.isEmpty())
2208 delete acts[i];
2209 }

2241
2242/*!
2243 \reimp
2244*/
2245QSize QMenu::sizeHint() const
2246{
2247 Q_D(const QMenu);
2248 d->updateActionRects();
2249
2250 QSize s;
2251 for (int i = 0; i < d->actionRects.size(); ++i) {
2252 const QRect &rect = d->actionRects.at(i);
2253 if (rect.isNull())
2254 continue;
2255 if (rect.bottom() >= s.height())
2256 s.setHeight(rect.y() + rect.height());
2257 if (rect.right() >= s.width())
2258 s.setWidth(rect.x() + rect.width());
2259 }
2260 // Note that the action rects calculated above already include
2261 // the top and left margins, so we only need to add margins for
2262 // the bottom and right.
2263 QStyleOption opt(0);
2264 opt.initFrom(w: this);
2265 const int fw = style()->pixelMetric(metric: QStyle::PM_MenuPanelWidth, option: &opt, widget: this);
2266 s.rwidth() += style()->pixelMetric(metric: QStyle::PM_MenuHMargin, option: &opt, widget: this) + fw + d->rightmargin;
2267 s.rheight() += style()->pixelMetric(metric: QStyle::PM_MenuVMargin, option: &opt, widget: this) + fw + d->bottommargin;
2268
2269 return style()->sizeFromContents(ct: QStyle::CT_Menu, opt: &opt, contentsSize: s, w: this);
2270}
2271
2272/*!
2273 Displays the menu so that the action \a atAction will be at the
2274 specified \e global position \a p. To translate a widget's local
2275 coordinates into global coordinates, use QWidget::mapToGlobal().
2276
2277 When positioning a menu with exec() or popup(), bear in mind that
2278 you cannot rely on the menu's current size(). For performance
2279 reasons, the menu adapts its size only when necessary, so in many
2280 cases, the size before and after the show is different. Instead,
2281 use sizeHint() which calculates the proper size depending on the
2282 menu's current contents.
2283
2284 \sa QWidget::mapToGlobal(), exec()
2285*/
2286void QMenu::popup(const QPoint &p, QAction *atAction)
2287{
2288 Q_D(QMenu);
2289 d->popup(p, atAction);
2290}
2291
2292void QMenuPrivate::popup(const QPoint &p, QAction *atAction, PositionFunction positionFunction)
2293{
2294 Q_Q(QMenu);
2295 if (scroll) { // reset scroll state from last popup
2296 if (scroll->scrollOffset)
2297 itemsDirty = 1; // sizeHint will be incorrect if there is previous scroll
2298 scroll->scrollOffset = 0;
2299 scroll->scrollFlags = QMenuPrivate::QMenuScroller::ScrollNone;
2300 }
2301 tearoffHighlighted = 0;
2302 motions = 0;
2303 doChildEffects = true;
2304 updateLayoutDirection();
2305
2306 q->ensurePolished(); // Get the right font
2307
2308 // Ensure that we get correct sizeHints by placing this window on the correct screen.
2309 // However if the QMenu was constructed with a Qt::Desktop widget as its parent,
2310 // then initialScreenIndex was set, so we should respect that for the lifetime of this menu.
2311 // However if eventLoop exists, then exec() already did this by calling createWinId(); so leave it alone. (QTBUG-76162)
2312 if (!eventLoop) {
2313 bool screenSet = false;
2314 QScreen *screen = topData()->initialScreen;
2315 if (screen) {
2316 if (setScreen(screen))
2317 itemsDirty = true;
2318 screenSet = true;
2319 } else if (QMenu *parentMenu = qobject_cast<QMenu *>(object: parent)) {
2320 // a submenu is always opened from an open parent menu,
2321 // so show it on the same screen where the parent is. (QTBUG-76162)
2322 if (setScreen(parentMenu->screen()))
2323 itemsDirty = true;
2324 screenSet = true;
2325 }
2326 if (!screenSet && setScreenForPoint(p))
2327 itemsDirty = true;
2328 }
2329
2330 const bool contextMenu = isContextMenu();
2331 if (lastContextMenu != contextMenu) {
2332 itemsDirty = true;
2333 lastContextMenu = contextMenu;
2334 }
2335
2336 // Until QWidget::metric accepts the screen set on a widget (without having a window handle)
2337 // we need to make sure we get a window handle. This must be done near here because
2338 // we want the screen to be correctly set and items to be marked dirty.
2339 // (and screen set could 'fail' on oldscreen == newScreen if created before causing the
2340 // itemsDirty not to be set though needed to get the correct size on first show).
2341 if (!windowHandle()) {
2342 createWinId();
2343 }
2344
2345#if QT_CONFIG(menubar)
2346 // if this menu is part of a chain attached to a QMenuBar, set the
2347 // _NET_WM_WINDOW_TYPE_DROPDOWN_MENU X11 window type
2348 q->setAttribute(Qt::WA_X11NetWmWindowTypeDropDownMenu, on: qobject_cast<QMenuBar *>(object: topCausedWidget()) != nullptr);
2349#endif
2350
2351 emit q->aboutToShow();
2352 const bool actionListChanged = itemsDirty;
2353
2354 QRect screen;
2355#if QT_CONFIG(graphicsview)
2356 bool isEmbedded = !bypassGraphicsProxyWidget(p: q) && QMenuPrivate::nearestGraphicsProxyWidget(origin: q);
2357 if (isEmbedded)
2358 screen = popupGeometry();
2359 else
2360#endif
2361 screen = popupGeometry(screen: QGuiApplication::screenAt(point: p));
2362 updateActionRects(screen);
2363
2364 QPoint pos;
2365 QPushButton *causedButton = qobject_cast<QPushButton*>(object: causedPopup.widget);
2366 if (actionListChanged && causedButton)
2367 pos = QPushButtonPrivate::get(b: causedButton)->adjustedMenuPosition();
2368 else
2369 pos = p;
2370
2371 const QSize menuSizeHint(q->sizeHint());
2372 QSize size = menuSizeHint;
2373
2374 if (positionFunction)
2375 pos = positionFunction(menuSizeHint);
2376
2377 const int desktopFrame = q->style()->pixelMetric(metric: QStyle::PM_MenuDesktopFrameWidth, option: nullptr, widget: q);
2378 bool adjustToDesktop = !q->window()->testAttribute(attribute: Qt::WA_DontShowOnScreen);
2379
2380 // if the screens have very different geometries and the menu is too big, we have to recalculate
2381 if ((size.height() > screen.height() || size.width() > screen.width()) ||
2382 // Layout is not right, we might be able to save horizontal space
2383 (ncols >1 && size.height() < screen.height())) {
2384 size.setWidth(qMin(a: menuSizeHint.width(), b: screen.width() - desktopFrame * 2));
2385 size.setHeight(qMin(a: menuSizeHint.height(), b: screen.height() - desktopFrame * 2));
2386 adjustToDesktop = true;
2387 }
2388
2389#ifdef QT_KEYPAD_NAVIGATION
2390 if (!atAction && QApplicationPrivate::keypadNavigationEnabled()) {
2391 // Try to have one item activated
2392 if (defaultAction && defaultAction->isEnabled()) {
2393 atAction = defaultAction;
2394 // TODO: This works for first level menus, not yet sub menus
2395 } else {
2396 for (QAction *action : std::as_const(actions))
2397 if (action->isEnabled()) {
2398 atAction = action;
2399 break;
2400 }
2401 }
2402 currentAction = atAction;
2403 }
2404#endif
2405 if (ncols > 1) {
2406 pos.setY(screen.top() + desktopFrame);
2407 } else if (atAction) {
2408 for (int i = 0, above_height = 0; i < actions.size(); i++) {
2409 QAction *action = actions.at(i);
2410 if (action == atAction) {
2411 int newY = pos.y() - above_height;
2412 if (scroll && newY < desktopFrame) {
2413 scroll->scrollFlags = scroll->scrollFlags
2414 | QMenuPrivate::QMenuScroller::ScrollUp;
2415 scroll->scrollOffset = newY;
2416 newY = desktopFrame;
2417 }
2418 pos.setY(newY);
2419
2420 if (scroll && scroll->scrollFlags != QMenuPrivate::QMenuScroller::ScrollNone
2421 && !q->style()->styleHint(stylehint: QStyle::SH_Menu_FillScreenWithScroll, opt: nullptr, widget: q)) {
2422 int below_height = above_height + scroll->scrollOffset;
2423 for (int i2 = i; i2 < actionRects.size(); i2++)
2424 below_height += actionRects.at(i: i2).height();
2425 size.setHeight(below_height);
2426 }
2427 break;
2428 } else {
2429 above_height += actionRects.at(i).height();
2430 }
2431 }
2432 }
2433
2434 QPoint mouse = QCursor::pos();
2435 mousePopupPos = mouse;
2436 const bool snapToMouse = !causedPopup.widget && (QRect(p.x() - 3, p.y() - 3, 6, 6).contains(p: mouse));
2437
2438 if (adjustToDesktop) {
2439 // handle popup falling "off screen"
2440 if (q->isRightToLeft()) {
2441 if (snapToMouse) // position flowing left from the mouse
2442 pos.setX(mouse.x() - size.width());
2443
2444#if QT_CONFIG(menubar)
2445 // if the menu is in a menubar or is a submenu, it should be right-aligned
2446 if (qobject_cast<QMenuBar*>(object: causedPopup.widget) || qobject_cast<QMenu*>(object: causedPopup.widget))
2447 pos.rx() -= size.width();
2448#endif // QT_CONFIG(menubar)
2449
2450 if (pos.x() < screen.left() + desktopFrame)
2451 pos.setX(qMax(a: p.x(), b: screen.left() + desktopFrame));
2452 if (pos.x() + size.width() - 1 > screen.right() - desktopFrame)
2453 pos.setX(qMax(a: p.x() - size.width(), b: screen.right() - desktopFrame - size.width() + 1));
2454 } else {
2455 if (pos.x() + size.width() - 1 > screen.right() - desktopFrame)
2456 pos.setX(screen.right() - desktopFrame - size.width() + 1);
2457 if (pos.x() < screen.left() + desktopFrame)
2458 pos.setX(screen.left() + desktopFrame);
2459 }
2460 if (pos.y() + size.height() - 1 > screen.bottom() - desktopFrame) {
2461 if (snapToMouse)
2462 pos.setY(qMin(a: mouse.y() - (size.height() + desktopFrame), b: screen.bottom()-desktopFrame-size.height()+1));
2463 else
2464 pos.setY(qMax(a: p.y() - (size.height() + desktopFrame), b: screen.bottom()-desktopFrame-size.height()+1));
2465 }
2466
2467 if (pos.y() < screen.top() + desktopFrame)
2468 pos.setY(screen.top() + desktopFrame);
2469 if (pos.y() + menuSizeHint.height() - 1 > screen.bottom() - desktopFrame) {
2470 if (scroll) {
2471 scroll->scrollFlags |= uint(QMenuPrivate::QMenuScroller::ScrollDown);
2472 int y = qMax(a: screen.y(),b: pos.y());
2473 size.setHeight(screen.bottom() - (desktopFrame * 2) - y);
2474 } else {
2475 // Too big for screen, bias to see bottom of menu (for some reason)
2476 pos.setY(screen.bottom() - size.height() + 1);
2477 }
2478 }
2479 }
2480 const int subMenuOffset = q->style()->pixelMetric(metric: QStyle::PM_SubMenuOverlap, option: nullptr, widget: q);
2481 QMenu *caused = qobject_cast<QMenu*>(object: causedPopup.widget);
2482 if (caused && caused->geometry().width() + menuSizeHint.width() + subMenuOffset < screen.width()) {
2483 QRect parentActionRect(caused->d_func()->actionRect(act: caused->d_func()->currentAction));
2484 const QPoint actionTopLeft = caused->mapToGlobal(parentActionRect.topLeft());
2485 parentActionRect.moveTopLeft(p: actionTopLeft);
2486 if (q->isRightToLeft()) {
2487 if ((pos.x() + menuSizeHint.width() > parentActionRect.left() - subMenuOffset)
2488 && (pos.x() < parentActionRect.right()))
2489 {
2490 pos.rx() = parentActionRect.left() - menuSizeHint.width();
2491 if (pos.x() < screen.x())
2492 pos.rx() = parentActionRect.right();
2493 if (pos.x() + menuSizeHint.width() > screen.x() + screen.width())
2494 pos.rx() = screen.x();
2495 }
2496 } else {
2497 if ((pos.x() < parentActionRect.right() + subMenuOffset)
2498 && (pos.x() + menuSizeHint.width() > parentActionRect.left()))
2499 {
2500 pos.rx() = parentActionRect.right();
2501 if (pos.x() + menuSizeHint.width() > screen.x() + screen.width())
2502 pos.rx() = parentActionRect.left() - menuSizeHint.width();
2503 if (pos.x() < screen.x())
2504 pos.rx() = screen.x() + screen.width() - menuSizeHint.width();
2505 }
2506 }
2507 }
2508 q->setGeometry(QRect(pos, size));
2509#if QT_CONFIG(effects)
2510 int hGuess = q->isRightToLeft() ? QEffects::LeftScroll : QEffects::RightScroll;
2511 int vGuess = QEffects::DownScroll;
2512 if (q->isRightToLeft()) {
2513 if ((snapToMouse && (pos.x() + size.width() / 2 > mouse.x())) ||
2514 (qobject_cast<QMenu*>(object: causedPopup.widget) && pos.x() + size.width() / 2 > causedPopup.widget->x()))
2515 hGuess = QEffects::RightScroll;
2516 } else {
2517 if ((snapToMouse && (pos.x() + size.width() / 2 < mouse.x())) ||
2518 (qobject_cast<QMenu*>(object: causedPopup.widget) && pos.x() + size.width() / 2 < causedPopup.widget->x()))
2519 hGuess = QEffects::LeftScroll;
2520 }
2521
2522#if QT_CONFIG(menubar)
2523 if ((snapToMouse && (pos.y() + size.height() / 2 < mouse.y())) ||
2524 (qobject_cast<QMenuBar*>(object: causedPopup.widget) &&
2525 pos.y() + size.width() / 2 < causedPopup.widget->mapToGlobal(causedPopup.widget->pos()).y()))
2526 vGuess = QEffects::UpScroll;
2527#endif
2528 if (QApplication::isEffectEnabled(Qt::UI_AnimateMenu)) {
2529 bool doChildEffects = true;
2530#if QT_CONFIG(menubar)
2531 if (QMenuBar *mb = qobject_cast<QMenuBar*>(object: causedPopup.widget)) {
2532 doChildEffects = mb->d_func()->doChildEffects;
2533 mb->d_func()->doChildEffects = false;
2534 } else
2535#endif
2536 if (QMenu *m = qobject_cast<QMenu*>(object: causedPopup.widget)) {
2537 doChildEffects = m->d_func()->doChildEffects;
2538 m->d_func()->doChildEffects = false;
2539 }
2540
2541 if (doChildEffects) {
2542 if (QApplication::isEffectEnabled(Qt::UI_FadeMenu))
2543 qFadeEffect(q);
2544 else if (causedPopup.widget)
2545 qScrollEffect(q, dir: qobject_cast<QMenu*>(object: causedPopup.widget) ? hGuess : vGuess);
2546 else
2547 qScrollEffect(q, dir: hGuess | vGuess);
2548 } else {
2549 // kill any running effect
2550 qFadeEffect(nullptr);
2551 qScrollEffect(nullptr);
2552
2553 q->show();
2554 }
2555 } else
2556#endif
2557 {
2558 q->show();
2559 }
2560
2561#if QT_CONFIG(accessibility)
2562 QAccessibleEvent event(q, QAccessible::PopupMenuStart);
2563 QAccessible::updateAccessibility(event: &event);
2564#endif
2565}
2566
2567/*!
2568 Executes this menu synchronously.
2569
2570 This is equivalent to \c{exec(pos())}.
2571
2572 This returns the triggered QAction in either the popup menu or one
2573 of its submenus, or \nullptr if no item was triggered (normally
2574 because the user pressed Esc).
2575
2576 In most situations you'll want to specify the position yourself,
2577 for example, the current mouse position:
2578 \snippet code/src_gui_widgets_qmenu.cpp 0
2579 or aligned to a widget:
2580 \snippet code/src_gui_widgets_qmenu.cpp 1
2581 or in reaction to a QMouseEvent *e:
2582 \snippet code/src_gui_widgets_qmenu.cpp 2
2583*/
2584QAction *QMenu::exec()
2585{
2586 return exec(pos: pos());
2587}
2588
2589
2590/*!
2591 \overload
2592
2593 Executes this menu synchronously.
2594
2595 Pops up the menu so that the action \a action will be at the
2596 specified \e global position \a p. To translate a widget's local
2597 coordinates into global coordinates, use QWidget::mapToGlobal().
2598
2599 This returns the triggered QAction in either the popup menu or one
2600 of its submenus, or \nullptr if no item was triggered (normally
2601 because the user pressed Esc).
2602
2603 Note that all signals are emitted as usual. If you connect a
2604 QAction to a slot and call the menu's exec(), you get the result
2605 both via the signal-slot connection and in the return value of
2606 exec().
2607
2608 Common usage is to position the menu at the current mouse
2609 position:
2610 \snippet code/src_gui_widgets_qmenu.cpp 3
2611 or aligned to a widget:
2612 \snippet code/src_gui_widgets_qmenu.cpp 4
2613 or in reaction to a QMouseEvent *e:
2614 \snippet code/src_gui_widgets_qmenu.cpp 5
2615
2616 When positioning a menu with exec() or popup(), bear in mind that
2617 you cannot rely on the menu's current size(). For performance
2618 reasons, the menu adapts its size only when necessary. So in many
2619 cases, the size before and after the show is different. Instead,
2620 use sizeHint() which calculates the proper size depending on the
2621 menu's current contents.
2622
2623 \sa popup(), QWidget::mapToGlobal()
2624*/
2625QAction *QMenu::exec(const QPoint &p, QAction *action)
2626{
2627 Q_D(QMenu);
2628 return d->exec(p, action);
2629}
2630
2631QAction *QMenuPrivate::exec(const QPoint &p, QAction *action, PositionFunction positionFunction)
2632{
2633 Q_Q(QMenu);
2634 q->ensurePolished();
2635 q->createWinId();
2636 QEventLoop evtLoop;
2637 eventLoop = &evtLoop;
2638 popup(p, atAction: action, positionFunction);
2639
2640 QPointer<QObject> guard = q;
2641 (void) evtLoop.exec();
2642 if (guard.isNull())
2643 return nullptr;
2644
2645 action = syncAction;
2646 syncAction = nullptr;
2647 eventLoop = nullptr;
2648 return action;
2649}
2650
2651/*!
2652 \overload
2653
2654 Executes a menu synchronously.
2655
2656 The menu's actions are specified by the list of \a actions. The menu will
2657 pop up so that the specified action, \a at, appears at global position \a
2658 pos. If \a at is not specified then the menu appears at position \a
2659 pos. \a parent is the menu's parent widget; specifying the parent will
2660 provide context when \a pos alone is not enough to decide where the menu
2661 should go (e.g., with multiple desktops or when the parent is embedded in
2662 QGraphicsView).
2663
2664 The function returns the triggered QAction in either the popup
2665 menu or one of its submenus, or \nullptr if no item was triggered
2666 (normally because the user pressed Esc).
2667
2668 This is equivalent to:
2669 \snippet code/src_gui_widgets_qmenu.cpp 6
2670
2671 \sa popup(), QWidget::mapToGlobal()
2672*/
2673QAction *QMenu::exec(const QList<QAction *> &actions, const QPoint &pos, QAction *at, QWidget *parent)
2674{
2675 QMenu menu(parent);
2676 menu.addActions(actions);
2677 return menu.exec(p: pos, action: at);
2678}

2693#endif
2694#if QT_CONFIG(menubar)

2696 mb->d_func()->setCurrentAction(nullptr);
2697#endif
2698 if (QMenuPrivate::mouseDown == this)
2699 QMenuPrivate::mouseDown = nullptr;
2700 d->hasHadMouse = false;
2701 if (d->activeMenu)
2702 d->hideMenu(menu: d->activeMenu);
2703 d->causedPopup.widget = nullptr;
2704 d->causedPopup.action = nullptr;
